info.title: Number Management
info.description: Number Management APIs are part of Zoom's API suite. They let developers manage and provision phone numbers in a Zoom Phone, Contact Center, or Meetings account programmatically. They also help businesses and service providers automate phone number operations at scale.

get.summary: List peering phone numbers for provider
get.description:
Returns phone numbers the carrier pushes to different customers.

**Prerequisites** 
* [Enable Number Management](https://zoom.us/cpw/page/phoneNumbers#/number-list)
* Developer is a provider exchange partner, with the cloud peering infrastructure established with Zoom.
* Zoom account needs to have a Zoom Phone license or a Zoom Contact Center license.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management_numbers:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management:read:list_carrier_peering_numbers:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records returned from a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: phone_number

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200` **OK**  
 Cloud peering numbers successfully returned.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

numbers.description: The information about the phone numbers pushed by the carrier to different customers.

assigned.description:
Whether the phone number is assigned:
* `false` — Unassigned.
* `true` — Assigned.

billing_ref_id.description:
Partners can specify their billing reference ID, with the maximum length of 36 characters. 
*  Zoom will send back the specified billing_ref_id in the SIP Header X-TO-CARRIER-ACCOUNT for the outbound calls to the provider.

phone_number.description: The phone number the partner provides in [E.164](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164) format.

service_info.description: Free form descriptive text of the service associated with the number. This description will be surfaced to Zoom customer viewing the phone number. Partners can include description highlighting the capabilities or limitations associated with the number. The maximum is 255 characters.

sip_trunk_name.description: This field is a unique name that Zoom assigns for a group of trunks established with the partner during the cloud peering infrastructure setup. A partner with global presence may have one or more SIP trunks to handle calls for phone numbers in different regions.Partner needs to specify the name of the SIP trunk associated with the specified phone number. All calls originating from this number will be routed through the specified SIP Trunk, and Zoom will expect to receive inbound calls through the same trunk.During failure scenarios, calls will be routed via alternate trunks within the same trunk group identified  by the `sip_trunk_name`.

status.description: Providers can set the status to indicate whether the phone number is active (true) or inactive (false).  Providers can use inactive (false) state to provision phone numbers that are still in the process of being ported in, and update the status to active (true) when the porting is complete.

total_records.description: The total number of records returned for this API call.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `1001`
Carrier not found

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden You do not have permission.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Returns the details associated with a specific phone number, or all the phone numbers the partner previously provisioned for the Zoom customer account.

**Prerequisites:** 
* [Enable Number Management](https://zoom.us/cpw/page/phoneNumbers#/number-list)
* Developer is a provider exchange partner, with the cloud peering infrastructure established with Zoom.
* Zoom account needs to have a Zoom Phone license or a Zoom Contact Center license. 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management_numbers:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management:read:list_peering_numbers:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records returned from a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: phone_number
carrier_code
parameters.description:
A unique code that Zoom provides to the partner at the time of establishing cloud peering infrastructure. This unique code is also tied to the developer `client ID` included as part of the token

This parameter is **required** if you do **not** use an OAuth token or the OAuth token does not contain the `clientId`.

200.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `200` **OK**<br>Carrier peering numbers successfully returned.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

numbers.description: The information about the carrier's phone numbers.

assigned.description: Whether the phone number is assigned:* `false` — Unassigned.* `true` — Assigned.

billing_ref_id.description:
Partners can specify their billing reference ID, with the maximum length of 36 characters. 
*  Zoom will send back the specified billing_ref_id in the SIP Header X-TO-CARRIER-ACCOUNT for the outbound calls to the provider.

allocated_product.description: Partners can allocate phone numbers for exclusive use by a specific Zoom Product (ZOOM_PHONE or ZOOM_CONTACT_CENTER). Partners can also make the Phone Numbers not specific to any product (UNALLOCATED), allowing Zoom customers to freely assign the numbers to any Zoom Product.

phone_number.description:
The phone number the partner provides in [E.164](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164
) format.

service_info.description: Free form descriptive text of the service associated with the number. This description will be surfaced to Zoom customer viewing the phone number. Partners can include description highlighting the capabilities or limitations associated with the number. The maximum is 255 characters.
service_info.example: Inbound only number' or 'Metered charges apply

sip_trunk_name.description:
This field is a unique name that Zoom assigns for a group of trunks established with the partner during the cloud peering infrastructure setup. A partner with global presence may have one or more SIP trunks to handle calls for phone numbers in different regions.
Partner needs to specify the name of the SIP trunk associated with the specified phone number. All calls originating from this number will be routed through the specified SIP Trunk, and Zoom will expect to receive inbound calls through the same trunk.
During failure scenarios, calls will be routed via alternate trunks within the same trunk group identified  by the `sip_trunk_name`.

status.description: Providers can set the status to indicate whether the phone number is active (true) or inactive (false).  Providers can use inactive (false) state to provision phone numbers that are still in the process of being ported in, and update the status to active (true) when the porting is complete.

total_records.description: The total number of records returned for this API call.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `1001`
Carrier not found

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden You do not have permission.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.description:
Allows provider exchange partners to add phone numbers to Zoom account. 

**Prerequisites** 
* [Enable Number Management](https://zoom.us/cpw/page/phoneNumbers#/number-list)
* Developer is a provider exchange partner, with the cloud peering infrastructure established with Zoom.
* Zoom account needs to have a Zoom Phone license or a Zoom Contact Center license.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management_numbers:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management:write:peering_number:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

carrier_code.description:
A unique code that Zoom provides to the partner at the time of establishing cloud peering infrastructure. This unique code is also tied to the developer `client ID` included as part of the token

This parameter is **required** if you do **not** use an OAuth token or the OAuth token does not contain the `clientId`.

allocated_product.description: Partners can allocate phone numbers for exclusive use by a specific Zoom Product (ZOOM_PHONE or ZOOM_CONTACT_CENTER). Partners can also make the phone numbers not specific to any product (UNALLOCATED), allowing Zoom customers to freely assign the numbers to any Zoom Product.

phone_numbers.description: The information about the added phone numbers. The maximum value is 200.

billing_ref_id.description:
The partner can specify their billing reference ID, with the maximum length of 36 characters. 
*  Zoom will send back the specified billing_ref_id in the SIP Header X-TO-CARRIER-ACCOUNT for the outbound calls to the provider.

phone_number.description:
The phone number the partner provides in [E.164](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164
) format.

number_type.description: This field enables you to specify if the number is a mobile number.

service_info.description: The free form descriptive text of the service associated with the number. This description surfaces to the Zoom customer viewing the phone number. Partners can include description highlighting the capabilities or limitations associated with the number. The maximum is 255 characters.

sip_trunk_name.description:
A unique name that Zoom assigns for a group of trunks established with the partner during the cloud peering infrastructure setup. A partner with global presence may have one or more SIP trunks to handle calls for phone numbers in different regions.
Partner needs to specify the name of the SIP trunk associated with the specified phone number. All calls originating from this number will be routed through the specified SIP trunk, and Zoom will expect to receive inbound calls through the same Trunk.
During failure scenarios, calls will be routed through alternate trunks within the same trunk group identified  by the `sip_trunk_name`.

status.description: Providers can set the status to indicate whether the phone number is active (true) or inactive (false).  Providers can use inactive (false) state to provision phone numbers that are still in the process of being ported in, and update the status to active (true) when the porting is complete.

201.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `201` **Created**   Peering phone numbers successfully added.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request some data failed **Error Code:** `1000`
Some data failed.for example: [ {"phoneNumber":"+12098888111","reason":"Invalid Sip Trunk"}, {"phoneNumber":"+12090000011","reason":"Invalid number"} ]
**Error Code:** `1001`
Carrier not found
**Error Code:** `1002`
Request data cannot be empty
**Error Code:** `1003`
Too many numbers, should less than 200

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden You do not have permission.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

delete.description:
Removes the phone number from the Zoom customer account. 

Partners can remove only the phone numbers they have previously added to Zoom account.

**Prerequisites:** 
* [Enable Number Management](https://zoom.us/cpw/page/phoneNumbers#/number-list)
* Developer is a provider exchange partner, with the cloud peering infrastructure established with Zoom.
* Zoom account needs to have a Zoom Phone license or a Zoom Contact Center license. 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management_numbers:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management:delete:peering_number:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: carrier_code
parameters.description:
This is unique code that Zoom provides to the partner at the time of establishing cloud peering infrastructure. This unique code is also tied to the developer `client ID` included as part of the token

This parameter is **required** if you do **not** use an OAuth token or the OAuth token does not contain the `clientId`.

parameters.name: phone_numbers
parameters.description:
The phone number the partner provides in [E.164](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164
) format.

200.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `200` **Created**   Phone number successfully deleted.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request request failed **Error Code:** `1000`
Some data failed. for example: [ {"phoneNumber":"+12098888111","reason":"Phone number does not exist"}, {"phoneNumber":"+12090000011","reason":"Invalid number"} ]
**Error Code:** `1001`
Carrier not found
**Error Code:** `1002`
Request data cannot be empty
**Error Code:** `1003`
Too many numbers, should less than 200

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden You do not have permission.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

patch.description:
Allows partners to update the status or details associated with the phone numbers.

**Prerequisites** 
* [Enable Number Management](https://zoom.us/cpw/page/phoneNumbers#/number-list)
* Developer is a provider exchange partner, with the cloud peering infrastructure established with Zoom.
* Zoom account needs to have a Zoom Phone license or a Zoom Contact Center license. 


**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management_numbers:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management:update:peering_number:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

carrier_code.description:
A unique code that Zoom provides to the partner at the time of establishing cloud peering infrastructure. This unique code is also tied to the developer `client ID` included as part of the token

This parameter is **required** if you do **not** use an OAuth token or the OAuth token does not contain the `clientId`.

allocated_product.description: `allocated_product` can only be updated for numbers that were previously set to 'UNALLOCATED'.  To change `allocated_product` value for phone numbers previously allocated to ZOOM_PHONE or ZOOM_CONTACT_CENTER, partners need to remove and reinsert the numbers.

phone_numbers.description: The list of phone numbers and the corresponding details that need to be updated. The maximum value is 200.

billing_ref_id.description:
Partners can specify their billing reference ID, with the maximum length of 36 characters.
*  Zoom will send back the specified billing_ref_id in the SIP Header X-TO-CARRIER-ACCOUNT for the outbound calls to the provider.

phone_number.description:
The phone number the partner provides in [E.164](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164
) format.

service_info.description: Free form descriptive text of the service associated with the number. This description will be surfaced to Zoom customer viewing the phone number. Partners can include description highlighting the capabilities or limitations associated with the number. The maximum is 255 characters.
service_info.example: Inbound only number' or 'Metered charges apply

sip_trunk_name.description:
A unique name that Zoom assigns for a group of trunks established with the partner during the cloud peering infrastructure setup. A partner with global presence may have one or more SIP trunks to handle calls for phone numbers in different regions.
Partner needs to specify the name of the SIP trunk associated with the specified phone number. All calls originating from this number will be routed through the specified SIP Trunk, and Zoom will expect to receive inbound calls through the same trunk.
During failure scenarios, calls will be routed via alternate trunks within the same trunk group identified  by the `sip_trunk_name`.

status.description: Providers can set the status to indicate whether the phone number is active (true) or inactive (false).  Providers can use inactive (false) state to provision phone numbers that are still in the process of being ported in, and update the status to active (true) when the porting is complete.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request request failed **Error Code:** `1000`
Some data failed.for example: [ {"phoneNumber":"+12098888111","reason":"Invalid Sip Trunk"}, {"phoneNumber":"+12090000011","reason":"Invalid number"} ]
**Error Code:** `1001`
Carrier not found
**Error Code:** `1002`
Request data cannot be empty
**Error Code:** `1003`
Too many numbers, should less than 200

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden You do not have permission.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

patch.description:
Allocates or unallocates phone numbers for those with CPL routing.

Note: When allocating phone numbers, if there are any native numbers, they must belong to the same country or region, and have the same number plan.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management_numbers:write:admin` **[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management:write:numbers:admin` **[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

allocated_product.description: The phone number's allocated product. Use the value UNALLOCATED to unallocate phone numbers.

site_id.description: The site the numbers will be allocated for Zoom Phone.

204.description: The phone numbers have been allocated succeefully

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request Invalid parameter or operation **Error Code:** `100002`
Phone number not found
**Error Code:** `200002`
Unable to switch products for the number
**Error Code:** `1002010`
The site does not exist

401.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `401`
Unauthorized Lack of valid authentication

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.description:
Adds BYOC (Bring Your Own Carrier) phone numbers to Zoom Phone.

**Prerequisites:** 
* A Business or Enterprise plan 
* A Zoom Phone license

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management_numbers:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management:write:byoc_numbers:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

allocated_product.description: The partners can allocate phone numbers for exclusive use by a specific Zoom Product (ZOOM_PHONE or ZOOM_CONTACT_CENTER).

country_iso.description:
The two-lettered country code (Alpha-2 code in ISO-3166 format). 
- When the input number is a local number, country_iso is required. 
- When the input number is a E164 number, `country_iso` is optional.

site_id.description:
The unique identifier of the site. This field is only required if you have enabled multiple sites in the account. See [Managing multiple sites](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020809672-Managing-multiple-sites) or [Adding a site](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020809672-Managing-multiple-sites#h_05c88e35-1593-491f-b1a8-b7139a75dc15) for details.
- If add a zoom phone number, and multiple sites is  enabled, `site_id` is required

phone_numbers.description: Whether a input local number or E164 number.

sip_group_id.description:
The SIP group ID.
- If adding a Zoom Phone number, and BYOC SIP Group is optional, `sip_group_id` is required. It can input  ZOOM_PHONE or COMMON `sip_group_id`
- If adding a Zoom Contact Center number, `sip_group_id` is required, and can input ZOOM_CONTACT_CENTER or COMMON `sip_group_id`.

enable_pci_pal.description:
- If you add a Zoom phone number and want to enable `enable_pci_pal`, you first need to enable Enable Compliance APIs in the Zoom Phone OP.
- If you add a Zoom Contact Center number and want to enable `enable_pci_pal`, you first need to enable PCI SIP Integration in the Zoom Contact Center OP.

201.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `201` **Created**   BYOC phone numbers successfully added.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `1000`
Some data failed.for example: [ {"phoneNumber":"+12098888111","reason":"Phone Number format invalid"}, {"phoneNumber":"+12090000011","reason":"Phone Number already exists"} ]
**Error Code:** `1004`
BYOC Phone Numbers are not enabled for this account
**Error Code:** `1003_001`
Too many numbers, should less than 100,contact zoom support team for more numbers
**Error Code:** `100_001`
Sip Group not found
**Error Code:** `200_005`
Current sip group don't support PCIPal
**Error Code:** `1002_003`
Site cannot be empty in zoom phone
**Error Code:** `1002_010`
The site does not exist

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden You do not have permission.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description: Returns a list of phone numbers in an account. See section Information in the phone number table of [Using Number Management for managing phone numbers](https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0074457#h_60222313850311712763891581) for more details. **[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management_numbers:read:admin` **[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management:read:list_numbers:admin` **[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: allocated_product
parameters.description: The product associated with the allocated number.

parameters.name: number_type
parameters.description: The type of phone number.

parameters.name: number_status
parameters.description: The status of phone number.

parameters.name: number_source
parameters.description: The source of phone number.

parameters.name: site_id
parameters.description: The site ID for the Zoom phone number.

parameters.name: assigned_to_type
parameters.description: The type of target assigned to the number.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: This field allows you to search by phone number. Only prefix matching is available for search.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

id.description: The unique identifier of the phone number.

number.description: The phone number in E.164 format.

allocated_product.description: The product assigned to the phone number.

display_name.description: The display name for the phone number in Zoom Phone.

caller_id_name.description: The caller ID name for a Contact Center number.

carrier.description: The carrier information for the Provider Exchange number.

capability.description: The capability of the phone number.  The value can be Incoming, Outgoing, Messaging, PCIPal, and `EmergencyCalls` or any combination of them.

items.description: The capability of the phone number

address_line1.description: The house number and street name.

address_line2.description: The information about the building, floor, unit, and so on.

county.description: The county of the address for the Ireland address.

state_code.description: The state ISO code of the address.

country.description: The two-lettered country code (Alpha-2 code in ISO-3166 format).

emergency_address.description: The emergency address to bind to the phone number.

address_update_required.description: The true value indicates the number's address need to be updated for BYOC Premise numbers.

emergency_address_update_time.description: The updated timestamp of the number's address, in the format 'yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ'. It's used for Phone BYOC-Premises numbers.

site.description: The site associated with the phone number.

assigned_to_id.description:
In Zoom Phone, this value can represent the ID of the user, emergency number pool (where the ID is either `siteId` if multiple sites are enabled, or `accountId` if not), or company location, depending on the `assigned_to_type `field.
In Contact Center, this field also has different meanings
2: number assigned to Dial-in to Video Engagements 
3: number assigned to Default System Outgoing SMS
4: number assigned to Default Caller ID
8: number assigned to Default Agent Outgoing SMS
Other: number assigned for specific use case , such as flow, queue and so on.

assgined_to_name.description: The name of the user assigned with the number, emergency number pool, and company location.

assigned_to_type.description: This field indicates to whom the phone number belongs.

source_channel.description: The channel of number that is only for Contact Center.

extension_number.description: The extension number of an extension (e.g., user) for Zoom Phone

name.description: The ID of the SIP group. See the **Creating SIP groups** section in [Creating a shared directory of external contacts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360037050092-Creating-a-shared-directory-of-external-contacts) for details.

city.description: The phone number of the city location.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `999`
Invalid value (e.g., allocated_product, number_type, number_soruce)
**Error Code:** `1002010`
The site does not exist
**Error Code:** `1003100`
The next page token is either invalid or has expired

401.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `401`
Unauthorized Lack of valid authentication

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: A list of phone numbers to be delete.

204.description: The phone numbers have been deleted successfully.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request Invalid parameter **Error Code:** `100002`
Phone number not found

401.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `401`
Unauthorized Lack of valid authentication

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description: Returns information about an account's phone number. For more details, see the section Information in the phone number table in [Using Number Management for managing phone numbers](https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0074457#h_60222313850311712763891581). **[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management_numbers:read:admin` **[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management:read:numbers:admin` **[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: phoneNumberId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the phone number retrieved from the [List phone numbers](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/phone/#tag/carrier-reseller/GET/phone/carrier_reseller/numbers) API.

id.description: The unique identifier of the phone number.

number.description: The phone number in E.164 format.

allocated_product.description: The product assigned to the phone number.

number_type.description: The type of the phone number.

display_name.description: The display name of the phone number for Zoom Phone numbers.

caller_id_name.description: The caller ID name for the Contact Center numbers.

carrier.description: The carrier information for Provider Exchange numbers.

capability.description: The capability of the phone number. The value can be Incoming, Outgoing, Messaging, PCIPal and Emergency Calls or any combination of them.

items.description: The capability of the phone number.

address_line1.description: The house number and street name.

address_line2.description: The field lists the building, floor, unit, and so on.

county.description: The county of the address, applicable for an Ireland address

state_code.description: The state ISO code of the address.

country.description: The two-lettered country code (Alpha-2 code in ISO-3166 format)

emergency_address.description: The emergency address bind to the phone number.

address_update_required.description: The true value indicates the number's address need to be updated, applicable for BYOC Premise numbers.

emergency_address_update_time.description: The updated timestamp of the number's address, in the format 'yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ'. It's used for Phone BYOC-Premises numbers.

site.description: The site associated with the phone number.

assigned_to_id.description:
In Zoom Phone, this value can represent the ID of the user, emergency number pool (where the ID is either `siteId` if multiple sites are enabled, or `accountId` if not), or company location, depending on the `assigned_to_type` field.
In Contact Center, this field also has different meanings.
2: Number assigned to Dial-in to Video Engagements 
3: number assigned to Default System Outgoing SMS
4: number assigned to Default Caller ID
8: number assigned to Default Agent Outgoing SMS
Other: number assigned for specific use case , such as flow, queue.

assgined_to_name.description: The name of the user to whom the number, emergency number pool, and company location are assigned.

assigned_to_type.description: This field indicates to whom the phone number belongs.

source_channel.description: The channel of number. (Only for Contact Center)

extension_number.description: The extension number of an extension. (e.g., user). This field is applicable for Zoom Phone.

meeting_id.description: The meeting ID for Phone meeting service.

id.description: The audio prompt file ID. If the audio was removed from the user's audio library, it will be marked with a prefix, `removed_vWby3OZaQlS1nAdmEAqgwA` for example. You can use this audio ID to get the audio information in the [Get an audio item](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/phone/methods#tag/Audio-Library/operation/GetAudioItem) API.

name.description: The audio file name of the greeting prompt.

greeting.description: This field applicable for meeting service.

id.description: The audio prompt file ID. If the audio is no longer in the user's audio library, it will be marked with a prefix, `removed_vWby3OZaQlS1nAdmEAqgwA` for example. You can use this audio ID to get the audio information in the [Get an audio item](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/phone/methods#tag/Audio-Library/operation/GetAudioItem) API.

name.description: The audio file name of the on hold music prompt.

on_hold_music.description: This field applicable for the meeting service.

display_number.description: The displayed phone number in meeting invitations and emails for the meeting service.

label.description: This label appends to the number in parentheses, and appears in meeting invitations and the Zoom client for the meeting service.

id.description: The ID of the SIP group. For details, see the **Creating SIP groups** section in [Creating a shared directory of external contacts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360037050092-Creating-a-shared-directory-of-external-contacts).

401.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `401`
Unauthorized Lack of valid authentication

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found The phone number not found

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

patch.description:
Updates a phone number's information.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management_numbers:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management:update:numbers:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: phoneNumberId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the phone number retrieved from the List Phone Numbers API.

display_name.description: Zoom Phone numbers use a phone number display name with a limit of 32 characters or fewer.

caller_id_name.description: The caller ID name has 15 characters or fewer, and should have at least one alpha character. The Contact Center supports only US/CA Virtual Service numbers.

confirm_address_update.description: Whether to confirm the emergency address update for Zoom Phone BYOC Premises numbers.

sip_group_id.description: This field retrieves the SIP group ID from the List Sip Group API for use with BYOC Premise phone numbers.

incoming.description: A value of true enables the capability. A value of false disables it.

outgoing.description: A value of true enables the capability. A value of false disables it.

204.description: Succeed to update the phone number

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request Invalid parameter or operation **Error Code:** `999`
Invalid Field
**Error Code:** `100001`
Sip Group not found
**Error Code:** `200001`
The capability cannot be updated

401.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `401`
Unauthorized Lack of valid authentication

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found Phone number not found

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Retrieves an account's  phone number plan information, phone number usage, and availability.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management_numbers:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management:read:numbers_plan:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: The product (e.g., ZOOM_PHONE).

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

200.description: The phone number plan usage information.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

assigned.description: The total number of phone number plans.

available.description: The remaining number of phone number plans to assign.

subscribed.description: The total number of phone number plan subscriptions bought.

name.description: The name of the phone number plan.

is_unlimited.description: If the plan is unlimited, the value is true; any other value indicates a limited plan.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `999`
Invalid param (product)
**Error Code:** `1002006`
product cannot be empty
**Error Code:** `1003100`
The next page token is either invalid or has expired

401.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `401`
Unauthorized Lack of valid authentication

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: page_size

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200` **OK**  
 
SMS campaign listed successfully.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

display_name.description: The display name for the SMS campaign.

status.description: The status of the SMS campaign.

brand.description: The business information from Zoom account.

get.description:
Returns a specific SMS campaign.

**Prerequisites** 
* A Pro or higher account plan 
* A Zoom Phone license



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management_numbers:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management:read:sms_campaign:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200` **OK**  
 
SMS campaign details retrieved successfully.

display_name.description: The display name for the SMS campaign.

status.description: The status of the SMS campaign. Returns `--` if the campaign is in an exception status.

brand.description: The business information from Zoom account.

number.description: The phone number that is assigned to the SMS campaign.

response_to_opt_in.description: Automatic reply text message after receiving opt in message.
response_to_opt_in.example: ZOOM: Thank you for opting in for our texting notifications. Message frequency may vary. Message and Data Rates may apply. To end messaging from us, Reply with STOP. Reply with HELP for more information.

response_to_opt_out.description: Automatic reply text message after receiving opt out message.
response_to_opt_out.example: You are unsubscribed to texts from ZOOM. No more messages will be sent.

response_to_help.description: Automatic reply text message after receiving help message.
response_to_help.example: ZOOM: You can get more assistance by visiting https://zoom.us/. Text STOP to stop receiving messages from us. You can also text START to start receiving messages from us again. You can also refer to our privacy policy on our website.

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden You do not have permission.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found Invalid campaign ID.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.summary: Assign a phone number to SMS campaign
post.description:
[Assigns a phone number to the SMS campaign](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/5016496738445-SMS-MMS-10DLC-Compliance-for-Zoom-Phone-and-Zoom-Contact-Center#h_01FYVVQM1WMW5JD48YNY3J581B).

**Prerequisites** 
* A Business or Enterprise account 
* A Zoom Phone license



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management_numbers:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management:update:numbers:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: smsCampaignId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the campaign to which the phone number will be assigned.

requestBody.description: The phone number ID in the request body.

loa_authorizing_person.description: The name of the employee issuing the letter of authorization required to port in SMS capabilities on the numbers.

contact_number.description: The contact phone number of the employee issuing the letter of authorization required to port in SMS capabilities on the numbers.

title.description: The job title of the person authorizing and signing the leave of absence.

contact_emails.description: The contact email of the employee issuing the letter of authorization required to port in SMS capabilities on the numbers.

204.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `201`   
 
Phone numbers assigned successfully.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `1003004`
Insufficient campaign capacity.
**Error Code:** `1003`
Too many numbers, should less than 200

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden You do not have permission.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found Invalid campaign ID.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

delete.summary: Unassign phone number from SMS campaign
delete.description:
[Unassigns a phone number from an SMS campaign](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/5016496738445-SMS-MMS-10DLC-Compliance-for-Zoom-Phone-and-Zoom-Contact-Center#h_01FYVVSPVM8MZN4Y9EW5690QHH).


**Prerequisites:** 
* A Business or Enterprise account 
* A Zoom Phone license 
* The campaign must have been previously assigned a Zoom Phone number



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management_numbers:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `number_management:update:numbers:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: phone_number_ids
parameters.description: A list of phone numbers to unassign from the SMS campaign.

204.description:

The phone number has been unassigned successfully.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `1003`
Too many numbers, should less than 200

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden You do not have permission.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found Invalid campaign ID.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

contact_emails.description: The contact emails of transferring numbers.

original_billing_info.description: The ported numbers' original billing info.

printed_name.description: The printed names on transferring numbers.

carrier_account.description: The account associated to the carrier.

name.description: The display name of the SIP Trunk.

sbc_label.description: The Session Border Controller (SBC) routing label.

source_system.description: The source of BYOC SIP Trunk
